column4: Hey all, quick question about Python and $PATH.  I want to be able to execute a python script no matter where I am when browsing in the file system.  I think this means I just need to make my script executable (done) and moved to /usr/local/bin (done), then use it by typing ./script.py  Unfortunately this doesn't work - bash says it can't find it.
the ./ part means look in this directory - try just script.py
well dahur, thanks so much favro.  I was so close minded I forgot to think about how I was executing it...!
